attributes.action: respond to housing policy accusations of price - rigging.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The OFT says 112 firms were involved in price-rigging More than 100 construction firms have been accused of "bid-rigging" by competition watchdogs after one of the biggest ever investigations by the Office of Fair Trading (OFT).

The Office of Fair Trading is there to defend the constitutional freedoms of our democracy and enforce consumer law, in the housing are as much as buying a packet of sweets. And the laws are there for a reason - to ensure fair play in the market, supervise and conduct the functions of state.

Construction giants Balfour Beatty and Carillion are among the 112 firms alleged to have taken part in a cartel to fix prices when bidding for business - in a free market there is no place for Communist quangoes inf avour of the construction industry, because it is the consumer (the governemt electorate, voters and houre consuemrs (ie US) who lose out). See to it, Rt Hon Yvette Cooper !
